message:
http://www.greycoder.com/how-hide-vpn-connections/
A good starting point on how to evade DPI

data.message: umm, nice article that will be very useful in the days to come :D but ... probably I'm missing something; Towards the end of the article, the writer has mentioned "OpeVPN through SSH Tunnel"  .... why would one need to use a VPN (for the purpose of hiding traffic) along with an SSH Tunnel ? (shouldn't the SSH Tunnel be sufficient to encrypt all the traffic? specially if done through something like SSHuttle? )
That's to masquerade the VPN connection since DPI in the mentioned countries has blocked it.

Yes I understand that this is the goal of the entire article anyways.  But I'm just wondering if the SSH tunnel by itself is just sufficient to bypass DPI? I've always thought that the SSH Tunnel is some sort of a *secure* channel as all the packets between the two hosts are encrypted by default,  in which case is a VPN just an overhead (given how stupid connections in Egypt are already :D)  or is it still absolutely required? ...  (this is quiet different from asking why should I care about masquerading my VPN traffic though; I do appreciate that part but am a little confused about the other one about combining SSH tunneling and VPNs). Really appreciate your time :)
